item.title: Protect Tier 1. Sleep well at Night.
item.description: In case you have not yet protected Tier 0, consider reviewing our article about protecting Tier 0 the modern way. Tier 1 is more difficult to outline as there are typically different security levels, from highly critical (e.g. personal data or business secrets) to informative, or even public information. What remains the same is the “assume breach” approach: no matter which (Tier 1) system gets compromised, the infection must not spread. What causes us a lot of headaches is something we call “Permanently privileged Tier 1 accounts”: accounts which are members of the Local Administrators group...
